page.title: 01Description of O tford area.
page.content: The area consists of a section of the North Downs intersected by the A225 road and a railway. These cross the Pilgrims' Way which runs along the lower slopes. Most of the village of Otford , part of Shoreham and the edge of Kemsing are included. The area is mainly woodland and rough grazing with intensive farming in the Darent Valley. The woodland has natural flora of considerable interest and a few scattered farms and hamlets. The village of Otford (population c. 4000) is home to many commuters who use the service to London. It has a picturesue centre with pond, green and old church; several mediaeval, Georgian and Victorian houses 2and good amenities with close proximity to London and the motorway network.
